The angular speed of the cone when the cone has completed three revolutions is <math alttext="omega sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>.(b) Derive an expression for <math alttext="omega sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> in terms of <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math>, <math alttext="I" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>I</mi></math>, <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>B</mi></math>, <math alttext="F" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>F</mi></math>, and physical constants, as appropriate. Begin your derivation by writing a fundamental physics principle or an equation from the reference booklet.

In Scenario <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, the cone is reversed such that the string is wrapped around its outside from the tip of the cone to its base, as shown in Figure <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>. In this new scenario, the motor again exerts a constant force of magnitude <math alttext="F" overflow="scroll"><mi>F</mi></math> on the string. In this scenario, the angular speed of the cone when the cone has completed three revolutions is <math alttext="omega sub 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>. skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
